Package au.edu.sydney.hecfor.erp.product

Interface ProductList

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProductListImpl
    public interface ProductList
    This class provides access to Product module services to a consumer. Creates, stores, and manages Products.

    • Method Detail

      • addProduct

        Product addProduct​(int id,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String manufacturer)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates and adds a new product to the list. Note that no approval status is set by default.

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        An product with the given details will be added to the list.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the product to add. Must be positive, may not be zero. Must be unique in this list.
        name - The name of the product to add. May not be null or empty.
        manufacturer - The manufacturer of the product to add. May not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        The product that was created and added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If a product with the provided ID already exists in this list.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any argument requirements are breached

      • clear

        void clear()
        Empties the list.

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        The list will be empty.

      • findAll

        java.util.List<Product> findAll()
        Gets all products in the list.

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        None
        Returns:
        A list of all products in the list. Will not be null. Will be empty if no products exist.

      • findAll

        java.util.List<Product> findAll​(boolean finalised)
        Gets all products matching the given approval finalised status in the list.

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        None
        Parameters:
        finalised - The approval finalised status to match.
        Returns:
        A list of all products with a matching approval finalised status. Will not be null. Will be empty if no products match.

      • findAll

        java.util.List<Product> findAll​(java.lang.String field,
                                java.lang.String... terms)
        Gets all products matching the given field terms in the list.
        The 'field' parameter determines whether to search by 'approval' status or 'manufacturer' name.
        The terms are the elements in that field to search for. Only exact matches need to be included.
        For example, a search of ("manufacturer", "Pfizer", "AstraZeneca") will yield all products manufactured
        by either Pfizer or AstraZeneca. Search is case sensitive - you can just assume it will naively use .equals()

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        None
        Parameters:
        field - The field to match on. Must be one of either "manufacturer" or "approval".
        terms - The search terms to match on.
        Returns:
        A list of all products that match the given terms. Will not be null. Will be empty if no products match.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any argument requirements are breached

      • findOne

        Product findOne​(int id)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Retrieves a specific product by id.

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        None
        Parameters:
        id - The product id to retrieve. Must be positive, may not be zero.
        Returns:
        The matching product, or null if no match found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any argument requirements are breached

      • remove

        boolean remove​(int id)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Removes a specific product by id.

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        Any product matching the given ID will no longer exist in the list.
        Parameters:
        id - The product id to remove. Must be positive, may not be zero.
        Returns:
        True if a match was removed, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any argument requirements are breached
